Components

The almost-unaltered parts of the framework.

Blockquotes

Sometimes, you just need to take a section from another source and quote it stylistically. Sparkle fulfills that wish too! Simply add blockquote class to your <blockquote> tag. And, as with many of this framework's features, it also has many different styles. All you have to do is add blockquote--$type to the <blockquote> class list, where $type is either one of the following: primary, secondary, info, success, warning, or danger.

Example:

This is a default blockquote.
This is a primary blockquote.
This is a secondary blockquote.
This is an info blockquote.
This is a success blockquote.
This is a warning blockquote.
This is a danger blockquote.
<blockquote class="blockquote [blockquote--$type]">
    // Body of Element
</blockquote>

Grid

Sparkle.CSS uses Flexbox to create easy grid that self-adjusts its accordingly, for consistent column widths. Simply create <div> with a class named row, then create a child(ren) <div> with a class named col.

Example:

<div class="row [row--$type]">
    <div class="col">
        //Body of Column
    </div>
</div>

Example:

12
11
1
10
2
9
3
<div class="row">
    <div class="col-$x-of-12">
        //Body of Column
    </div>
    <div class="col-$y-of-12">
        //Body of Column
    </div>
</div>

Note: $y = 12 - $x

Example:

parent
child
child
10
auto
<div class="row">
    <div class="col">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col">
                // Body of Column
            </div>
            <div class="col">
                // Body of Column
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

Tables

In Sparkle, the table feature already comes fully responsive. There is no need to style each of its elements. Simply add the "table" class to the <table> tag.

Example:

First Name Last Name Age
John Smith 24
Maggie Johnson 37
Terry James 35
<table class="table [table--$type]">
    <thead>
        <tr>
            <td>Header Name 1</td>
            <td>Header Name 2</td>
            <td>Header Name 3</td>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td data-label="Header Name 1">Data Entry</td>
            <td data-label="Header Name 2">Data Entry</td>
            <td data-label="Header Name 3">Data Entry</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>

Note:

Be sure to label each <td> tag with data-label that reflects the appropriate row header.

Typography

The default font used in Sparkle is Google Font's Lato, with Helvetica Neue as its backup. The html font-size was reduced to 62.5% of its original size, so that the root EM units can be in multiples of 10. For example, a value of 1.2rem would be 12px, approximately. The root EM was set, by default, to 1.5rem, which is about 15px.

Example:

H1 (4.8rem)

H2 (4.2rem)

H3 (3.6rem)

H4 (2.8rem)

H5 (2.4rem)
H6 (1.8rem)

Paragraph (1.5rem)

Title

Subtitle

Paragraph

<h1>Text</h1>
<h2>Text</h2>
<h3>Text</h3>
<h4>Text</h4>
<h5>Text</h5>
<h6>Text</h6>
<p>Text</p>


<p class="text--title">Title text</p>
<p class="text--subtitle">Subtitle text</p>
<p class="text--paragraph">Paragraph text</p>
